Dating: OSORKON I/SEKHEMKHEPERRE (not before); 22ND DYNASTY; OSORKON II/USERMAATRE-SETEPENAMUN (not after)
Name: Fragment of the handle of a sistrum
Description: This lapis lazuli object is a small fragment of the handle of a sistrum. It bears the cartouche of either Osorkon I or Osorkon II, pharaohs of the 22nd Dynasty. The sistrum (see E.1802 and E.4581) is a musical instrument associated with the goddess Hathor and was used during various temple rituals and funerary ceremonies.
